div.l: Vnthanke come on his hande þat bonde hym so
And he that better schulde haue knytte the rayne
Alas qduod Iohn Aleyn For Cristes peyne
Laye downe thy swerde And I woll myne also
I is Fulle swyfte god wate As enye Ra
By goddes herte he schall notte scape us bathe
Why ne hadde þou putte þe caple in þe lathe
Ill hayle by god Aleyn þou is A Fonne
These selye Clarkes haue Fulle Faste yronne
Towarde the Fenne boþe Aleyn ⁊and eke Iohn
And whan þe Myller syghe þat they were gone
He halfe A busschelle of her Flowre haþe take
And badde his wyfe to knede hitt in A Cake
And sayde I trowe þe Clarkes werne Aferde
Yett can A Myller make A Clarkes berde
For All her art yett lette hem gone her waye
Loo where þey gothe ye lette the childron playe
They gette hym noughte so lyghtly by my Crowne
These selye Clarkes rynnen vpp̄e ⁊and downe
With kepe kepe stande stande iossa warderere
Ga whystil þou ⁊and I schall kepe hym here
Butte schortly tille hitt was vereye nyghte
They couþe notte þoughe þey didde all þ̉er myghte
Her caple cacche he ranne allwaye so Faste
Tylle in A dyche þey caughte hym atte laste
Werye And wete As beeste is in the rayne
Comeþe selye Iohn ⁊and with hym comeþe Aleyn
Alas qduod Iohn the daye þat I was borne
Now arne we dreven tille heþenge ⁊and to skorne
Ower corne is stole Men woll vs Fooles calle
Bothe the wardeyn And ower Fellawes all
And namelye the Myller so waylewaye
Thus pleyneþe Iohn As he gothe by the waye
